coli_erlang_reg.usage: [], print ongoing TLS and SSH sessions
coli_erlang_reg.description: Prints currently active TLS and SSH sessions.

Logging of cli / netconf operations.
Options: -d Disable logging of all cli/netconf operations.
-e Enable logging of all incoming cli/netconf operations. Each netconf and cli session is saved as a file so it can be replayed.
-a Enable logging of all incoming and outgoing netconf operations. Enable logging of all incoming cli operations. Each netconf and cli session is saved as a file so it can be replayed.

coli_erlang_reg.usage: arg: user, perform ldap authorization lookup
coli_erlang_reg.description: The use of this command is to visualize, understand (and debug) authorization. A single mandatory argument is taken to be a username, authorization will be performed of this user. As the authorization is performed, detailed information that describes what happens and intermediate results, are printed.

The use of this command is to visualize, understand (and debug) authentication and authorization. A single mandatory argument is taken to be a username, authorization will be performed of this user, a second optional argument will be taken as a "Password" causing authentication and authorization to be done. Detailed information is printed for each step.

coli_erlang_reg.usage: arg: filter [user], compile and visualize a lookup filter
coli_erlang_reg.description: This command is used to test what is to be input into the secM attribute: ManagedElement=1,SystemFunctions=1,SecM=1,UserManagement=1,LdapAuthenticationMethod=1,Ldap=1,Filter=1: filter. This attribute requires a filter of the syntax described in RFC4515, but it also accepts the input of \"\" which results in the replacement of the current username. The first argument which is mandatory should be a filter, e.g. (uid=smith), the second optional argument is a username that will be substituted into the filter if the special replacement syntax has been used.
